intro: Sagina quinquevalvis, commonly known as five-lobed sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant has succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. Its flowers are typically pink or white, and it blooms from spring to early summer. Sagina quinquevalvis is often found in gravelly soils and is adapted to full sun conditions.
